info.description:
This API enables the programmatic management of key components of an HPE SimpliVity configuration.

To access the API, request an authentication token by issuing an authentication request in the following form, where the username/password combination is a set of valid management credentials for the applicable hypervisor environment:

     curl -k https://simplivity@<host>/api/oauth/token -d grant_type=password -d username=<user> -d password=<pass>

Then, you can pass in the resulting access_token returned in each HTTP header using Authorization: Bearer token. For example:

     curl -H "Authorization: Bearer 0a08c809-17ff-479f-b0a8-aedd4d8305a0"

The access_token times out after 10 minutes of inactivity and expires after 24 hours.

Make sure to use TLS version 1.1 or greater.
info.title: HPE OmniStack REST API

tags.name: datastores
tags.description: A datastore is a data repository of files that constitute virtual machines.

tags.name: hosts
tags.description: A host is a virtual object that uses HPE OmniStack software in a federation.

tags.name: cluster_groups
tags.description: A set of omnistack_clusters that are able to perform backup and restore operations between each other

tags.name: security
tags.description: Includes the REST APIs that support security operations for HPE SimpliVity objects

tags.name: policies
tags.description: A policy contains backup rules that can be applied to an individual datastore or virtual_machine.

tags.name: backups
tags.description: A backup is a complete, standalone image of a specific virtual machine, taken at a specific point in time.

tags.name: external_stores
tags.description: An external (non HPE SimpliVity) destination for storing backups, such as an HPE StoreOnce Catalyst store

tags.name: virtual_machines
tags.description: A virtual_machine represents a single virtual machine created within an HPE SimpliVity datastore.

tags.name: omnistack_clusters
tags.description: An omnistack_cluster is a logical grouping of systems that run the HPE OmniStack software. The user defines an omnistack_cluster to efficiently share resources across the systems.

tags.name: tasks
tags.description: A task is created by the system to enable a client to track state changes where a managed object moves when it is created or modified.

post.summary: Deletes the specified list of backup instances

parameters.name: backups deletion information
parameters.description: backup_id: The list of the unique identifier (UID) of the backups that you want to delete

post.summary: Sets the retention time for the specified list of backups

parameters.name: backups retention information
parameters.description:
backup_id: The list of the unique identifier (UID) of the backups that you want to set the retention time for

force: An indicator to force a retention time modification even if this action results in deleting backups

Valid values:

True: Sets the new retention time for the specified list of backups. This action may delete of one or more backups.

False: Does not make the requested retention time modification if this results in deleting one or more backups. This operation returns a list of backups that the requested modification deletes. If the requested modification does not delete the backups, the retention time modification occurs.

Default: false

retention: The number of minutes to keep backups

Default: 00:00

False: The datastore is being shared in read-only mode.
